intro: Gyaladenia friesii var. kornasii, commonly known as the Kornasii bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
